snippet: President Hugo Chávez won re-election on Sunday, facing down the strongest electoral challenge of his nearly 14 years in office and gaining a new mandate to deepen his socialist revolution.
abstract: Venezuelan Pres Hugo Chavez wins third term, recording 54 percent of the vote over his opponent Henrique Capriles Radonski.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by María Eugenia Díaz, Jonathan Gilbert, Girish Gupta and Andrew Rosati from Caracas, and María Iguarán from Cumaná, Sucre State.

lead_paragraph: President Hugo Chávez won re-election on Sunday, facing down the strongest electoral challenge of his nearly 14 years in office and gaining a new mandate to deepen his socialist revolution.

headline.seo: Chávez Wins New Term in Venezuela, Holding Off Surge by Opposition
headline.main: Chávez Wins New Term in Venezuela, Holding Off Surge by Opposition
headline.print_headline: Chávez Wins a Third Term in Venezuela Amid Historically High Turnout
